p: These variations are due to the fact that the composition of the essential oils are quite complex and generally encompass (involves) various types of compounds. Thus, the standardization of harvest times, the part of the plant collected, and the cultivation under the same environmental conditions help in the identification of varieties that present differences in their chemical composition and concentration. Moreover, factors such as temperature, humidity, and soil may also influence mainly in plant species that have histological structures of essential oil storage on the surface of the leaves (Salgado et al. 2003).
